snippet: The street camp nestled on a street in the Causeway Bay area is the Liechtenstein of Hong Kong’s pro-democracy movement; a place so tiny and placid that, like an obscure Alpine principality, knowledge of its very existence seems an insider’s...
abstract: The street camp nestled on a street in the Causeway Bay area is the Liechtenstein of Hong Kong’s pro-democracy movement; a place so tiny and placid that, like an obscure Alpine principality, knowledge of its very existence seems an insider’s secret.
lead_paragraph: The street camp nestled on a street in the Causeway Bay area is the Liechtenstein of Hong Kong’s pro-democracy movement — a place so tiny and placid that, like an obscure Alpine principality, knowledge of its very existence seems an insider’s secret.

headline.main: Hong Kong Protest Camp That Whispered Melting Back Into City
